title: Mysteries of Flight
description: Buckle up: you are about to take off on an exciting journey! Mysteries of Flight gives students a history lesson on the evolution of airplanes and the people who first experimented with them. From hot air balloons to modern-day aircraft, airplanes have come a long way! Readers will discover the most fundamental element that makes a plane fly, the parts of an airplane, and how pilots control planes. Detailed photographs and graphics enhance the text. This book can be used to teach about cause-and-effect relationships as well as identifying possessive nouns.
highFrequencyWords: ailerons, aviation, elevators, lift, rudder, speculation
reviewWords: Use of vocabulary lessons requires a subscription to VocabularyA-Z.com.
